column2: format=A5 glossy paperback, black and white

column1: '''''Aiglos 20''''' is a jubilee Polish language issue of '''''[[Aiglos (journal)
column2: Aiglos]]'''''.<ref>''Aiglos''' 20 official page in Polish http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/numer20.php (accessed 4 September 2016)</ref><ref>''Aiglos''' 20 official page in English http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/english/issue20.php (accessed 4 September 2016)</ref>, which contains 326 pages filled with articles and artwork of artists from around the world. The highlight of the jubilee gallery is a page from the ''[[Parma Eldaliéva]]'' - a calligraphic art book in tengwar by 'Elmenel'. The first print run contains also a present in a form of decorative metal bookmark with ''Aiglos'' logo.

column1: ** ''Battle of Five Armies: Elves of Mirkwood''
** "Reinterpretation of the heroic ideal in Tolkien’s writings on the basis of selected fragments of ''The Lord of the Rings''"
** "All things considered, they shouldn’t be called by name. Proper names’ magic in Arda"
** "The Necromancer’s necromancy. Black magic, possession and zombie"
** "Éomer’s classical sources? Éomund’s son vs. young hero figure in antiquity"
*** conducted and translated by Łukasz Neubauer
** A collective review of ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'' by the editorial staff
** "Beasts, plants, creatures, and miraculous occurrences” - review of ''[[A Tolkien Bestiary]]'' by [[David Day]]
** “Bilbo, or rather his ‘biographer’, astray” - review of ''[[Bilbo's Journey: Discovering the Hidden Meaning in The Hobbit]]'' by [[Joseph Pearce]]
** “A new trend in blockbusters?” - review of the extended DVD edition of ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug]]''
** Report from Medieval Fantasy Symposium 2014 in Unieście, Poland
** "Would J.R.R. Tolkien attend Tolk-Folk?" - report from XVI Tolk-Folk in Bielawa, Poland
** "What to make of this Hobbit?" a polemic against Maria Błaszkiewicz’s article
** "What to make of this Hobbit?" answer to Tadeusz Andrzej Olszański’s polemic
** "A few more words on Gil-galad’s paternity" – a polemic  against Barbara Cecylia Liwo’s article "Gil-galad – a paternity case"
The issue contains also a hobbit genealogical crossword puzzle by Karolina Stopa-Olszanska 'Melinir' and Tolkien news from Poland and abroad.
* [http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/english/issue20.php Detailed description of the contents of ''Aiglos'' 20 at ''Aiglos''' official page]
